alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 1:47AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Hartford and southwestern Hampden Counties through 245 AM EDT... At 146 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Torrington to near Thomaston to Beacon Falls. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. Torrential rainfall and frequent lightning can also be expected. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Hartford, New Britain, West Hartford, Bristol, Southington, Newington, Windsor, Wethersfield, Farmington, Simsbury, Bloomfield, Berlin, Rocky Hill, Avon, Plainville, Suffield, Granby, Canton, Southwick, and Burlington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. These storms may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.
